Title.text: 1.3. Install and Configure SAP Cloud Connector

Text.text: SAP Cloud Connector connects your on-premise landscape with your SCP account, you need to download, install and setup it, please refer to https://cloudplatform.sap.com/capabilities/integration/cloud-connector.html for guidance and help
Setup HTTPS connection between SCC and Gateway.

Title.text: 2.1. Connect SAP Solution Manager and your SAP Gateway

Text.text: We suggest customer to setup a SAP Gateway system on front of SAP Solution Manager system to expose OData services. In this landscape SAP Solution Manager takes the role of backend business system. The Gateway is not mandatory to be a new system, exist Gateway can be reused. The lowest support Gateway version: \nSAP_GWFND 740 SP16.

Title.text: 2.2. Register OData Services on your SAP Gateway

Text.text:
Following Odata Services on SAP Solution Manager should be exposed via your Gateway system, please add them to your Gateway:
1) SAI_USER_MAPPING_SERV (OAuth2 service)
2) SAI_MESSAGE_SRV (OAuth2 service)
3) SAI_ALERT_SERV (OAuth2 service)

In SAP Cloud Connector, expose following SAP Gateway systemâ€™s web services:
/sap/bc/sec/oauth2/token
/sap/opu/odata/IWFND
/sap/opu/odata/sap/Z_SAI_ALERT_SERV
/sap/opu/odata/sap/Z_SAI_MESSAGE_SRV
/sap/opu/odata/sap/Z_SAI_RFC_SRV
/sap/opu/odata/sap/Z_SAI_USER_MAPPING_SERV

Title.text: 2.3. Setup Trust Relationship Between WeChat Integrator and your SAP Gateway

Text.text: WeChat Integrator, which is deployed on cloud, should be able to exchange information with your Gateway system via OData services, you need to enable that by setup trust relationship between WeChat Integrator and your Gateway.
We need to get local SAML provider of your gateway system, they are necessary to communicate with your gateway from technical point of view.
